prefix_dialog.content: I have my family .. they live about an hour away but they are very good listeners

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Waiting for the time to pass is like torture sometimes, I know

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am happy you have more support

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Do you have a car or a way to get there if you wanted to?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think the hardest thing that I am going to have to surpass is being able to trust again.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: well the fact that you recognize that is a big deal

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I personally do not own a vehicle of my own. It is one that belongs to my partner. I am trying to save up to get my own

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Accepting the truth is the hardest

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That is great you have started saving

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I figured if I don't, I would probably have a hard time getting over it you know?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: there are many new money saving APP's out there, some make it easy to achieve a goal, maybe that is something you could check out?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah.. but how does one go about gaining back the trust of others or getting themselves to that state of mind where they are comfortable with it again?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I understand what you are saying

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes for sure. I am going to look up some apps. thank you for that

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Opening themselves up to the opportunity to be hurt again.....

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, the issue with my best friend really complicates things for me. I feel the pressure to either confront her about the betrayal or just cut her out completely. It's difficult because I don't want to make a rash decision that could affect my family dynamic.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It’s understandable to feel stuck between those two options. Navigating friendships can be really challenging, especially in tough situations.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I need to figure this out soon, though, as I can’t keep living with this tension. Should I confront her about what she did or should I just distance myself from her? What would be the best way to handle this?

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really overwhelming. It's hard to deal with such a painful situation.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V3 violation because it only offers empathy without addressing the explicit urgent help request made in Turn 3, ignoring the Seeker's need for practical guidance on how to choose between confronting her friend or distancing herself.

samples.situation: I recently lost my grandmother and today grief came out of nowhere for the first time in a few weeks. Feeling very down.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: yeah absolutely! It is just a very bad day and will be over sooner than later

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Maybe you should treat yourself to something. Favorite dinner or dessert. Cozy up with a good book. Just try to lighten your spirits, or distract yourself.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah thats a good idea

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Always helps!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I just wish I wasn't going to be stuck in my room all night

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yea feels like weve all been stuck in our rooms for ever. Have you tried any virtual meet ups?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah luckily I've been able to see my family once in awhile and what not

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: and some friends

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I really appreciate your support today

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well thats good. Always good to stay connect.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Not a problem, i enjoyed our chat. I hope you take care!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: thank you! me too.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: same to you!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks!

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been thinking about my grandmother a lot today. It’s hard not to remember her laughter.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really tough. It’s natural to remember those joyful moments, especially on difficult days.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Yeah, I just keep thinking about the fun times we had together.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Those memories can be both comforting and bittersweet. Maybe you could write some of those memories down or even share stories about her with your family.

samples.situation: The person ghosted me after we had an argument and I am really upset about it.

prefix_dialog.content: I'm doing well, thank you!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I've had the same thing done to me and I can remember being extremely distraught.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah, I just do not know what to do

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Do you mind me asking what the argument was about? If you don't mind going into a little more detail, I may be able to help you more.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I was sick and he did not call me all day to even check in on me. I told him that I was upset about that.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That must be such a terrible feeling. So the argument started because you were sick, he didn't check in on you at all for that entire day, and when you expressed your feelings to him, it turned into an argument?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you tried reaching out to him throughout the course of these past two weeks to see if he would respond?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Exactly, and I keep wondering if I said something that really upset him.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's natural to question things like that, especially in a relationship. Have you had a chance to think about what you might want to say if you do reach out to him?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Yeah, I think it would be nice to have that routine. I just miss talking to them and sharing what we're all going through.

generated_dialog.content: Absolutely, keeping in touch can really make a difference. Have you thought about what topics you'd like to discuss or activities you might do together?

samples.situation: My best friend is addicted to meth

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: He got arrested for stealing to fund his addiction.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I had a neighbor who was doing meth, and he got arrested, and that actually saved his life. He had to get sober and look at what he was doing.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: There is a hard line between helping a friend who is addicted and actually enabling them. Have you ever heard of this?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Sadly my friend has been arrested a few times, spent time in prison, and is fully locked in his lifestyle. He's such a great person, very funny, nice, but he is lost

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It can be very hard to watch a loved one destroy their lives. Has anyone every discussed an intervention?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: He has alienated all of his friends, including me. I was the last one holding on

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: My husband and I actually have worked with recovering drug addicts and alcoholics. We are retired now, but still volunteer. Sometimes we have to let go of our loved ones - they have to hit rock bottom. Very hard to do, but unless they see their behavior as destructive, they don't want to change.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I agree, I'm afraid that's what I have to do. Another one of our mutual friends passed away recently to an overdose. I don't want to lose another friend.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you seen the serenity prayer? Knowing what to do, what not to do and accepting life really is a great thing to ask God for. We can't change others. Yet you have to find a way to have peace.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes. I know I have to let go. I've punished myself trying to stay in his life.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It's very hard to lose friends to addictions. It's epidemic in our society now. However, you can pray for them and look for ways to keep your life on track so you don't get lost focusing on them and not where you want to go.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: all drugs are bad, but meth is a truly evil drug.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It's just rotting his soul and body.  He believes he can't stop and you're right, letting go and just sending prayers is all i can really do now

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: very evil, I agree, I like to write out a list of things I can do to distract myself from overly being concerned, if that makes sense. Like I take time to think about them and pray for them, then I have to move on with my life, so a list helps me think of where I want to go and how to get there. Even if it is just a list of how to clean my pantry! lol

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: My husband just got me a daytimer, and I write my goals in that for the new year, and I try to check it every day and try to focus on moving forward, because life has a way of throwing us curveballs like this, and we can't get stuck in them.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's a good idea.  I don't have many friends left, close friends that is, and this guy is my best friend of 20 years. We were in a touring rock band together.  He's my last close friend.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It is hard to lose friends that we have had for years. Maybe you can write that on your list -- perhaps just brainstorm ways to make new friends - take a college class, join a gym, take a dance class, volunteer at church, something like that. That way you open up yourself to make new friends.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I’ve been thinking about how I can help him from a distance. It’s tough knowing I can’t really be in his life right now.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's understandable to want to help while also needing to protect yourself. Have you thought about what kind of boundaries you might need to set?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Yeah, I think I need to limit my communication with him. It’s hard, but I know it’s for the best.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds like a wise decision. It might also be helpful to focus on activities that bring you joy and fulfillment. What are some things you enjoy doing?

samples.situation: My partner said he loved me and led me on.  Then he went to cheat on me after one year of pretending he truly loved me.  I am so sad and lonely and he is always with friends.  It just isn't fair.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I do worry a lot.  If he would commit fully to me that would help perhaps.  If he never cheated again but I don't know if he can do that reliably.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: What would you define as full commitment from him?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think marriage, but then again if he cheats then what commitment is that really if it ends in divorce?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That's true and divorce can be expensive. You mentioned before that you feel like you are with him mostly because you are lonely, is that how your relationship started?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's a good point you make.  I was lonely and wanting to fill that void.  But, I do want a family.  I'm just not sure he is that committed or even mature enough to handle this responsibility. Perhaps I'm naive.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I don't think you are naive, you are clearly asking yourself the right questions about building a future with him

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks for the encouragment.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Do you have friends and family around that could help distract you from the loneliness until you find someone you are comfortable starting a family with?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Maybe that would be a good plan as I am close with my family.  Thanks!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Of course! There also probably community resources where you can meet new people and explore new interests! Unfortunately I think a lot of that might have to wait til Covid passes

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks that might be another suggestion to consider.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Of course! Anything else on your mind you would like to discuss?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: When will this COVID ever end?  It's even hard to find new partners

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I know, I've heard some people have found success with zoom dates.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been thinking about how difficult it is to even meet new people right now. It feels so isolating.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That's understandable; the restrictions can really make it hard to connect with others. Have you considered trying any virtual meetups or groups that focus on interests you enjoy?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I haven't really looked into that yet. It sounds like a good idea, but I worry about putting myself out there.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's totally normal to feel that way. Maybe starting with a small group where you can share something you love might feel less daunting and help you feel more connected.

samples.situation: The feel of isolation during pandemic and being an immigrant without any family closeby.

prefix_dialog.content: Are you able to video chat with them? Possibly with skype, facebook messenger, or zoom. Seeing their faces on the screen could help to ease the sadness.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds like a difficult situation to be in, and it's understandable to feel torn between those options.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really overwhelming. It's clear that you care a lot about making your family happy.

samples.situation: I wish I had a girlfriend. I haven't seen any friends outside of my household since last October!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Robin Williams talked about that situation.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: He said that he didn't fear being alone as much as being with people that he didn't like.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Did he really? Well, it's sad how he ended up, I'm too scared to commit suicide like he did! I enjoy living life, even when I have months at a time without human connection

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Adult entertainers provide one kind of companionship, but it is not complete. It feels like a stopgap to me. Is it fulfilling enough for you?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: You're right, I just lack self confidence in my poetry....hopefully I'll figure out a way to spit it out on a blog or something

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You could trade poems with other budding poets. "I'll show you mine if you show me yours."

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Do you find yourself to be more an introvert or an extrovert?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Oh it's been very fulfilling for me when I've had the opportunity to use it. Most of them are genuine women. Only a handful have tried to take advantage of me.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm definitely an extrovert

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That was a clever pun by the way

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It's ironic and strange how many people struggle with that stupid voice in their head that tells them they're not good enough to accomplish anything.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks. Ok. The pandemic is particularly hard on extroverts. People look down on sex workers, but I think that the world is a big complex place and people are trying to make their way in it. If everyone is consenting, I see no problem.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you tried psilocybin? Some people swear that it changes the inner monologue for the better. I am not a physician, but for long-term adjustment, it might be beneficial.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Well of course it's consentual. I would never NOT ask for permission to do things with a sex worker, or any person.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'll have to Google that, I've never heard of that, but thanks for the advice!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Sure! I'm glad we had a chance to chat. Best of luck with making friends/girlfriends after the pandemic!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: BTW, is there a quit button on your end?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I feel like I'm just sinking deeper into this hole of loneliness. It's overwhelming, and I don't really know how to cope anymore.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It sounds really tough to be in such a dark place. I'm here for you, and it's okay to feel this way.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Sometimes I think about just ending it all. I can't stand feeling this way.
